Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Chest Bioreactance and Calibrated Pulse Contour Analysis in Thoracic Cancer Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: This prospective monocentre observational study was conducted at a tertiary university hospital.

Participants.evidence: Fifty adult patients undergoing thoracic cancer surgery were included.

Intervention.evidence: Simultaneous measurements of cardiac index (CI) using bioreactance (CI-NICOM) and PCA calibrated by transthoracic echocardiography (CI-PCA) were performed.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare chest bioreactance with calibrated pulse contour analysis (PCA) for cardiac output measurement.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the interchangeability of CI-NICOM and CI-PCA, assessed by Bland–Altman analysis and percentage error calculation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fifty adult patients undergoing thoracic cancer surgery were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A significant difference was found between CI-PCA and CI-NICOM: 2.4 ± 0.8 vs. 2.9 ± 0.9 l min −1 m −2, respectively (P < 0.001).
